New Records: England recorded their second-highest powerplay score against India in a T20I with 63 for 0 in six overs.
Key Match Events: England won by 10 wickets with 24 balls remaining.
Jos Buttler scored 80* and Alex Hales scored 86* leading England to victory.
Hardik Pandya scored 63 off 33 balls for India.
Virat Kohli scored 50 runs for India.
Chris Jordan took 3 wickets for 43 runs for England.
Adil Rashid took 1 wicket for 20 runs for England.
England's openers chased down the target of 169 in just 16 overs.
Pre-Game Insights: India chose to bat first, preferring Rishabh Pant's left-handedness over Dinesh Karthik's finishing skills due to the dimensions of the Adelaide Oval.
Mark Wood and Dawid Malan were out injured for England, with Chris Jordan and Phil Salt coming in.
Post-Match Reflections: England's win was attributed to doing the basics right and protecting the short square boundary in Adelaide.
Jos Buttler and Alex Hales' performance was highlighted as game-changing.
England's strategy of using data to gain an advantage was emphasized.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played under lights at the Adelaide Oval.
The pitch had plenty of bounce and the ball was coming onto the bat nicely.
India's death-overs hitting was phenomenal, scoring 58 runs in the last four overs.
